basic.title: What is Ethereum?
basic.shortDescription: Ethereum prides itself on being  'The worldâ€™s computer' which is why it is a base for developers to deploy smart contracts using its Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)

basic.title: What is Bitcoin?
basic.shortDescription: Bitcoin is a network of secure digital signatures that do not require the use of a third party hashing transactions together to form a chain

basic.title: What is Polygon?
basic.shortDescription: Polygon is a layer 2 scaling solution built off of Ethereum and  helps move transaction data off the main chain to increase throughput and reduce transaction cost while also maintaining base-layer security

basic.title: What is Avalanche?
basic.shortDescription: Avalanche is an EVM-compatible alternative layer 1 blockchain which seeks to rival Ethereum with faster network throughput and  tools to enable developers to build scalable dApps on the network

basic.title: What is a BNB Chain?
basic.shortDescription: BNB Chain is an EVM compatible smart-contract enabled sidechain of the Binance network which runs on the proof-of-stake consensus model and processes network transactions with a total of 41 validators

basic.title: What is a Private Key?
basic.shortDescription: A private key is made up of randomly generated  alphanumeric characters which enable a user to sign and authorise a transaction on a blockchain network

basic.title: What is a Seed Phrase?
basic.shortDescription: A seed phrase is a 12 or 24 word phrase that is generated by a crypto wallet which allows a user to securely interact with a blockchain network

basic.title: What is Gas?
basic.shortDescription: Gas can be described as the fuel that powers activities on the Ethereum network (or other EVM), and determines the amount of network fee a user needs to pay to carry out transactions on it

defi.title: What is DeFi?
defi.shortDescription: DeFi describes an ecosystem of smart-contract-based protocols that offer a wide variety of financial services directly to users without an intermediary

defi.title: What is a DEX?
defi.shortDescription: A DEX is a blockchain application that uses smart-contract technology to facilitate peer-to-peer crypto transactions or exchanges without the need for a third party

defi.title: How to trade tokens on DEX?
defi.shortDescription: To trade on a DEX, a user must create and fund a crypto wallet, connect the wallet on a DEX platform, and select the tokens they wish to trade or swap

defi.title: Why do you need to approve a token?
defi.shortDescription: Tokens need to be approved to validate that authorisation of the assets owner and control access to user funds by a protocol

defi.title: Security in DeFi
defi.shortDescription: DeFi is marred with various security risks such as project scams and loss of private keys which leads to loss of funds, therefore it is crucial to adopt best security practices to protect your crypto assets and funds

defi.title: How to manage your token portfolio on multiple chains?
defi.shortDescription: DeFi wallet aggregators such as Plasma.Finance allow users to track, organise and carry out various DeFi activities across multiple blockchain networks from a single, easy-to-use user interface

defi.title: What is a Lending Protocol?
defi.shortDescription: Lending protocols such as Aave and Compound are smart contract based services in DeFi which allow users to access crypto loans in trustless and permissionless manner

defi.title: Difference between DEX and CEX
defi.shortDescription: Cryptocurrencies can be traded or exchanged either on a DEX or a CEX, and while a DEX requires no intermediary to facilitate crypto assets trades, a CEX facilitates crypto exchanges through a central authority

defi.title: What is Token Bridge?
defi.shortDescription: A token bridge is an infrastructure that exists to facilitate interoperability between individual blockchain networks to allow for the free flow of value across multiple chains

defi.title: What is Staking?
defi.shortDescription: Staking is the process of depositing crypto assets on a proof-of-stake-based blockchain network to maintain it's security architecture by validating network transactions and earning rewards in return

defi.title: What is Liquidity Mining?
defi.shortDescription: Liquidity mining is a process of using attractive yields to incentivize asset holders to deposit their assets on a protocol to increase market efficiency through deep liquidity

defi.title: What is DEX Aggregator?
defi.shortDescription: A DEX aggregator is a DeFi protocol that combines the various individual DEXs to optimize market rates for users in terms of asset prices and liquidity

defi.title: What is HyperDEX?
defi.shortDescription: HyperDEX is a fully decentralised DeFi cross-chain aggregator which provides users with the best asset prices, reduced slippages and increased liquidity by tapping into the liquidity of various individual DEXs

defi.title: 3 Ways to generate passive income with crypto
defi.shortDescription: One of the attractive features of crypto is the ability to generate passive income on idle crypto assets, and 3 common ways to do is include, staking, lending and liquidity provisioning

defi.title: What is DAO?
defi.shortDescription: A DAO is a community-centric organisation which is run by rules embedded in smart-contract codes that is executed automatically when specific conditions are met without the interference of any centralised entity
